subject: BASKETBALL
HOCKEY, ICE
lead_paragraph: Nobody said the playoffs were going to be pretty. At least the N.B.A. and N.H.L. games Wednesday night went light on barbarism, reversing the recent trend, but they went even lighter on aesthetics. There were whole stretches of the 76ers' victory over the Celtics that made James Naismith and his peach baskets look evolved by comparison. And the Devils' victory over the Rangers in the N.H.L. Eastern Conference finals? It was what happens when two normally outstanding goalies become suddenly mystified by that black rubber disc and their teammates take turns playing as if their shin pads are on fire.
snippet: The Sixers, the Celtics, the Rangers and the Devils seem to have forgotten what got them this far in the playoffs: skill.
